{"rule":"COMMA_COMPOUND_SENTENCE","sentence":"^\\QThis impossibility of reducing the being-of-phenomena to the phenomena-of-being is explored rigorously by Sartre in his introduction, for even more sophisticated attempts at such a reduction is ultimately an appeal to knowledge as a foundation for being – with knowledge necessarily defined as the simple ratio or proportionality between an existent's being and it's appearing.\\E$"}
{"rule":"COMMA_COMPOUND_SENTENCE","sentence":"^\\QThis impossibility of reducing the being-of-phenomena to the phenomena-of-being is explored rigorously by Sartre in his introduction, for even more sophisticated attempts at such a reduction is ultimately an appeal to knowledge as a foundation for being – with knowledge necessarily defined as the simple ratio or proportionality between an existent's being and it's appearing \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"OUTSIDE_OF","sentence":"^\\QHence, the being-of-phenomena is by necessity separate and irreducible from the phenomena-of-being – which is to say that the being of phenomena lies outside of the object of phenomena itself.\\E$"}
{"rule":"COMMA_COMPOUND_SENTENCE","sentence":"^\\QThis impossibility of reducing the being-of-phenomena to the phenomena-of-being is explored rigorously by Sartre in his introduction, for even more sophisticated attempts at such a reduction is ultimately an appeal to knowledge as a foundation for being – with knowledge necessarily defined as the simple ratio or proportionality between an existent's being and it's appearing, i.e. phenomena \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
